ReboundTools 0.1.6
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Indifference curve lines

indifference_lines.Rd

This function calculates indifference curves to be drawn on the preferences graph.

indifference_lines(
  .rebound_data,
  graph_type = ReboundTools::graph_types$preferences,
  graph_params = ReboundTools::default_graph_params,
  q_dot_s_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$q_dot_s_orig,
  C_dot_o_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$C_dot_o_orig,
  f_Cs_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$f_Cs_orig,
  sigma = ReboundTools::orig_vars$sigma,
  q_dot_s_hat = ReboundTools::hat_vars$q_dot_s_hat,
  q_dot_s_bar = ReboundTools::bar_vars$q_dot_s_bar,
  C_dot_o_bar = ReboundTools::bar_vars$C_dot_o_bar
)

Arguments

.rebound_data

A data frame of rebound information, likely created by rebound_analysis().
graph_type

See ReboundTools::graph_types. Default is ReboundTools::graph_types$preferences.
graph_params

Parameters that control the appearance of the graph. Default is ReboundTools::default_graph_params.
q_dot_s_orig, C_dot_o_orig, f_Cs_orig, sigma

See ReboundTools::orig_vars.
q_dot_s_hat

See ReboundTools::hat_vars.
q_dot_s_bar, C_dot_o_bar

See ReboundTools::bar_vars.

Value

A data frame of indifference curves for a preferences graph.

Details

The preferences graph is always indexed, so there is no indexed argument.

Examples

load_eeu_data() %>% 
  rebound_analysis() %>% 
  indifference_lines()

#> # A tibble: 617 x 15
